attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description: The findings revealed a cumulative bread variance of +29 loaves polybags had a cumulative variance of -522 pieces.

value: This is noted and we will maintained
To be maintained
In the previous audit, the finished products had a cumulative shortfall of +33 loaves and polybags had a positive variance of 88 pieces.
A stock take exercise was conducted on 17th June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that the management have in place to safeguard company assets.
No material variance was noted indicating that stock controls are effective

attributes.title: Bread Weight check
attributes.description:
All sample varieties had minimal cases of underweight.                             
The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 05%, 400g W-05% and 800g W- 0%.

value: The good trend will be maintained
To be maintained
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are observed.

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
A total of 604 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.20% of the total loaves produced.                    

           
177 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.06% of the total sales over the audited period.            

                     
Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits

value: We will maintain
We will maintain
The previous audit findings indicated that market damages exceeded the set limit by 112 loaves.
Analysis of bread damages from 27.05.25 – 16.06.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.
Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits indicating that the company is not exposed to losses due to damages.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description: The cash count exercise  revealed no material variances between the physical cash on hand and the book balance.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that petty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: The positive trend will be maintained through continued adherence to the set cash handling procedures.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the previous audit spot checks conducted at the cash office, indicating consistency in applying the required controls.
A spot check was conducted at the branch cash office on 17th June 2025 to evaluate the adequacy of cash handling practices and the accuracy of record-keeping in line with company policies.
The immaterial variance indicates that effective cash handling and control procedures are being implemented

attributes.title: Minishop Spot-check
attributes.description: All shop attendants accurately accounted for their stock, with no variances noted. Stock records were properly maintained and physical stock counted match the system balances.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue implementing and adhering to the established Minishop Management SOPs to maintain the current level of compliance.

value: We will maintain the trend trend by ensuring that SOPs are adhered to.
Minishop SOPs will continue to be observed.
No variances were noted in previous audit spot-checks, indicating consistency in compliance with stock control procedures.
Spot-checks were carried out at the branch minishops to evaluate compliance with established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) governing stock management.
The absence of variances indicates that effective stock control measures are in place and that minishop operations are being conducted in accordance with company policy.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
The total good bread produced over the audited period is 20,634 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 213 workers.                                
                                
A total of 210 workers were hired leading to an actual efficiency of 98.3 crates per worker which is within the range.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should maintain the proper planning of packaging workers to maintain efficient operations and cost control.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
Packaging efficiency was also achieved in the previous audit findings
An audit review was conducted covering the period 27th May to 16th June 2025 to assess packaging efficiency and determine whether the branch met the set target of 97 crates per worker.
The target packaging efficiency was achieved indicating adherence to planned staffing levels and cost control.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
The branch hired a total of 277 workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 1,440 bags.                                             
The actual production was 1,462 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 5.28 bags per worker which is within the range.
attributes.recommendation: Proper planning of production workers should be maintained

value: The positive trend will be maintained
We will maintain
The set production efficiency was also achieved as per the previous audit findings.
A review of production efficiency was conducted from 27th May to 16th June 2025 was done to determine whether the branch met the set target of 5.2 bags per worker.
The set efficiency was achieved indicating that production was effectively planned and the budgeted labour cost was observed.

attributes.title: Delivery vehicle fuel usage analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis was done for the three vehicles assigned to the branch KCW 094A, KDH 543N and KCC 338Z. Comparison of the actual fuel used and the standard fuel revealed immaterial variances.                        
                        
No material variance between the actual fuel used and the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.

value: We will maintain
The positive trend will be maintained.
Fuel consumption was within the range for the three vehicles in the previous audit findings.
A fuel efficiency audit was conducted for the month of May 2025 to evaluate whether delivery vehicles operated within the company’s standard fuel consumption rates.
Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Generator fuel usage analysis
attributes.description: During the review period, the generator operated for 41.8 hours and consumed 920 litres of fuel. This gives an average consumption rate of 22.0 litres per hour, which is within the standard rate of 28 L/Hr set for the branch generator.
attributes.recommendation: Proper controls over generator usage and fuel monitoring should be maintained to ensure continued efficiency and cost control.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 15.7 L/Hr.
A review of generator fuel usage and machine hour records was conducted for the period from 1st to 31st May 2025 to evaluate whether generator fuel usage adhered to company policies.
No material variance is noted indicating that proper generator controls and adherance to company policies.
